title: Elon Musk brags about the power of his farts, gets Community Note'd about them on Twitter
description:
When Elon Musk bought Twitter and turned it into the free speech haven for the masses, I doubt that he thought he would find the pressure per square inch of his flatulence being challenged by his own Community Notes. Yet, it's 2023 and here we are.

Our story starts where it normally does. Elon Musk bored and trolling on Twitter. As it turns out, the average person farts nineteen times a day. Elon took the over.

— (@)

His farts are so deadly (not sure about silent) his mother and sister chimed in.

— (@)

This next part, I hope this was done out of sarcasm. I would HATE to know there is someone living in America who is this big of a hardo. Not that it would be the first time a meme or a joke was fact-checked. Still, this is a bit much.

Someone took a break from fact-checking the lies coming from Joe Biden and the media in order to fact-check if Elon's farts can REALLY inflate a tire.

— (@)

It is scientifically impossible.

Pneumatic rupture of the intestinal canal is one of the most uncommon conditions, and is due to the introduction of air under pressure into the oral cavity or the rectum.

Forty cases of pneumatic rupture of the alimentary canal, including one case of rupture of the esophagus, have been reported previously. The one reported and the three referred to in this paper increase the total to forty-four cases.

I love you, Internet. I love you so hard.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: "Great Movie!": Donald Trump hosts "Sound of Freedom" screening, praises the filmmakers
description:
Corporate journalismers are still on the warpath, creating content attacking "The Sound of Freedom." Get ready for them to cry more. Donald Trump hosted a screening of the movie at his golf club in Bedminster, New Jersey, on Wednesday night.

It's about child sex trafficking and is based on a true story. Because a lot of conservatives are happy such an important movie is kicking Hollywood's ass, the media has to hate it and be mortified at how much money it's making.

— (@)
You're supposed to enjoy or learn it's a combination, but it's a great movie. And I now understand why it’s doing so well. It's setting records, by the way. It’s beating the biggest movies out and some of the big summer blockbusters, and just knocking the socks off of them.

And right on schedule...

With a budget of $14.5 million, this film managed to tell a more poignant story than films with ten times its budget.“Sound of Freedom” has a genuine core of righteousness that most call-to-action films do not. This is a dramatic film, but it takes pains to show that real children need help now. And it does all this while giving us more of a heartfelt story than Hollywood has in years.

Yet the media is lining up to hate it. For whatever reason.

>

<

title: Watch: American eco-activists "take over" golf course, show what low-energy losers they are compared to UK comrades
description:
American leftists brought their performative slacktivism to the Sebonack Golf Club out in the Hamptons. It's rumored to have a $1 million initiation fee just to join. What follows is every other leftist protest you've seen. There's interpretive dance. Someone banging a drum. A girl dressed as a shark for... I don't know, reasons. And someone brought a pitchfork.

And then they all took out their iPhones to call an Uber to take them back to their mother's house. Not before stopping by Starbucks first.

— (@)

They don't just embarrass themselves and their families for generations to come. They also embarrass America. Are they useless sacks of soy? No doubt. But they're 'Merican sacks of the soy so you still want to see them kick ass as the best useless sacks of soy. Compared to their UK counterparts, I don't believe any of them are concerned about the schlimate this week.

UK activists have a clear message.

— (@)

UK protestors don't go to hoity-toity areas. They are out in the streets with the people. And inconveniencing the people because they're THAT serious. They aren't just interested in sacrificing their dignity.

— (@)

They will sacrifice priceless works of art.

— (@)

There is no pain threshold for UK slacktivists. They can get dragged across the street and go right back to stop people from going to work. Since none of them have jobs of their own.

Some Germans are now taking matters into their own hands: pic.twitter.com/mI8dghYPon
— CR1337 (@cryptonator1337) July 15, 2023

And I'm sorry, American slacktivists. If you aren't willing to risk having an appendage chopped off, you simply are not serious enough about the schlimate.

— (@)

European slackvists have the lady balls (even the guys) to risk life and limb to save the planet. All America gets are spiled rich kids, It wouldn't surprise me it these weirdos' parents were playing golf at the time. They were all sitting in the rec room and got board, so they decided to play protestor.

Do better, America.

>

<

title: Bud Light manages to find MORE bad news now that the bars and restaurants numbers are in
description:
There has to be a point where Bud Light stops getting hit with bad news. We are going on four months since they made the worst marketing decision in the history of marketing. But the hits keep coming. Anhesuer-Busch's water that identifies as beer is no longer the most popular beer being served in bars and restaurants.

It isn't even in the top three.

Down from #1 to #4


Newsweek is reporting that Bud Light was the #1 beer sold in bars and restaurants in the first quarter of 2023. Then the company signed a guy who presents as a girl that doesn't know what the Final Four is as a spokesman for their Final Four coverage, as opposed to any of the thousands of girls who enjoy college basketball.

Now they are #4 behind Miller Lite, Michelob Ulta, and Coors Light. The biggest drop-offs were in Texas and both South and NORTH CAR-O-LI-NA. The smallest drop-off was in California.

Michel Doukeris, Anheuser-Busch's global CEO, says the decline in Bud Light sales represented about 1% of the company's global sales volume. That tells you all you need to know about how little they give a sh*t about Middle America.

I live in a cave. Why the Bud Light controversy?


Here are the LWC Bud Light Keys to DERPtory:

  1. As part of Bud Light's NCAA tournament coverage, and to appeal to people who don't like either for some reason, someone at Bud Light decided to work with titface performer Dylan Mulvaney.
  2. Melissa Weinerchild, the (now former) VP of Marketing responsible, made it clear on a podcast how much she hated Bud Light's loyal fanbase, lashing out at them as fratty and out of touch.
  3. Fans from across the spectrum (NOT just the extreme right, we're not that organized) decided this was one woke pander from a company that hates them too many, and now Bud Light is no longer the #1 sold beer in America and fell out of the Top 10 for most popular.

The drop-off in bars and restaurants is a huge deal. I've always been a Drink Local guy, long before it became a conservative talking point. When I can't think about what I want or what I have a taste for, the first thing I look at is what haven't I tried before. People who aren't that into beer, when they can't think of something will say "Give me a Bud Light." And that's before we get to the (now former) loyal Bud Light drinkers.

Now customers are going for every other "I can't think of something" beer before they get to Anheusuer-Busch's water that identifies as beer. You just hate to see it happen.

(NARRATOR: No you don't)

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: "Nothing to apologize for": Country artists, presidential candidates defend Jason Aldean from the Left's outrage mob
description:
The controversy over Jason Aldean's "Try That in A Small Town" has reached the next phase of the culture war. Presidential candidates defending him for it. It's not surprising since a lot of what he sings about -- what he ACKSHUALLY sings about vs what the Left is accusing him of -- are the same issues they campaigning on.

Be sure to check back to the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website later today. I'm sure Karine Jean-Pierre will be asked about it at today's briefing and she'll have an unintentionally amusing response.

Explain the "Try That in a Small Town" Controversy like I'm five


Jason Aldean released a song in May called "Try That in a Small Town" that, in his own words, is about "the feeling of a community that I had growing up, where we took care of our neighbors, regardless of differences of background or belief. Because they were our neighbors, and that was above any differences."

A video was released last week that used real news footage of the chaos taking place in America, all of which took place in progressive cities and was the result of progressive policies.

Progressives and the media (but I repeat myself) hate having their agenda challenged, so they lashed out calling it "...a modern lynching song" with "very scary" AND "racist" lyrics.

The New York City-based MTV-owned CMT pulled the video amid the controversy.

Aldean, as of this writing, is standing his ground.

Where can I see the "Try That in a Small Town" video


Sucker punch somebody on a sidewalk

Carjack an old lady at a red light
Pull a gun on the owner of a liquor store
Ya think it's cool, well, act a fool if ya like

Cuss out a cop, spit in his face
Stomp on the flag and light it up
Yeah, ya think you're tough

Well, try that in a small town

Try That in A Small Town pic.twitter.com/d6QBJwkepy
— Louder with Crowder Dot Com (@LWCnewswire) July 20, 2023


Standing his ground is something country music legend Travis Tritt encourages him to keep doing. We need to normalize telling Twitter to shut the f*ck up.

— (@)


— (@)

Presidential candidate Ron DeSantis, who is a bit of a country music fan himself, knows what it's like to be the target of leftist hatred. He tells Aldean to stand strong.

— (@)

Another presidential candidate, Vivek Ramaswamy, also came to Aldean's defense. He also brought up the controversy involving Body Count's "Cop Killa" from the 90s. I always have that in the back of my head because, in the forty-one years since then, people still haven't caught on that their outrage over music doesn't do much other than sell MORE copies of a song they don't want people to hear. Guess where "Try That in a Small Town" is currently on the charts?

— (@)

Another of their fellow candidates, former president Donald Trump, calls Aldean a fantastic guy with a great new song. He called on his fans to support Aldean all the way,

— (@)

And while not a presidential candidate, I'm throwing in South Dakota governor Kristi Noem just because she is an absolute smoke show.

\u201cMy thoughts on \u201cTry that in a Small Town\u201d\u2026. @Jason_Aldean\u201d
— Kristi Noem (@Kristi Noem) 1689773059

Jason Aldean plays Cuyahoga Falls, Ohio tonight. Gee, I wonder if he'll have anything to say about the controversy on stage. Right before he plays the song and the crowd goes insane.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Five tweets to summarize IRS 'Whistleblower X,' a gay democrat, and his testimony before Congress
description:
Whistleblower X revealed himself before Congress on Wednesday and testified that federal prosecutors obstructed his probe of Hunter Biden to protect him from felony charges. Hunter is of course the son of Joe Biden and the federal prosecutors work in the federal government Hunter's dad is in charge of. SPOILER: There was a lot more Hunter could have been banged for outside of the sweetheart deal he got.

Funny because when we mention Hunter and "banging," it tends to mean prostitutes. Trust me. We've got plenty of that coming up.

My personal opinion about hearings is that they are a lot of bluster and mugging to the cameras for content. They are up there with the State of the Union Address when it comes to silly political theater. Plus the reality is nothing will happen until conservatives take back the White House (and also nominate someone who can win a general election). We know the Bidens are scumbags. You know the Bidens are scumbags. The Left and the media know as well, hence they're twisting themselves into pretzels trying to avoid acknowledging "Geez, this stuff looks bad."

Here are a few tweets from yesterday to store away for future reference. But first, who is "Whistleblower X" other than someone who worked on the Hunter Biden criminal tax investigation?

Joe Ziegler, a special agent with the tax agency for 13 years, described himself as a "gay Democrat married to a man" and said he decided to come forward despite his personal politics because he believes "no one should be above the law regardless of your political affiliation." It was the first public appearance by Ziegler, who had previously given closed-door testimony to Congress under the alias "Whistleblower X."

Ziegler revealed a LOT of money from Hunter's foreign business dealings. Remember, Hunter's dad is the former president of the United States and Hunter NEVER discussed business matters with him. Hashtag foreshadowing.

— (@)

In an interview with CBS News, Zeigler was uncomfortable answering a question about if he saw any evidence Joe Biden financially benefited from his son’s deals.

— (@)

There can't be a discussion about Hunter Biden without mention of his fondness for prostitutes. Because you got to give the people what they want.

— (@)

Democrats know the all-day testimony was bad for them because they spent most of it bringing up their favorite distraction when things are going bad for them. The former president of the United States.

— (@)

Finally, remember when I hashtagged "foreshadowing" before? This is just unfortunate...

— (@)

And as a bonus tweet, here is Rep. Margorie Taylor Greene introducing into the congressional record photos of Hunter Biden banging whores.

— (@)

The American people have known for a while that there are two justice systems in America. Exhibit Q is Hunter Biden getting the same deal every other spoiled rich kid gets if their dad is powerful enough. The fact that Hunter's dad is the President of the United States makes it a bigger slap in the face.

These hearings won't lead to any direct action. A year and a half of reminding the American people about the detail is a different story.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.
